Sentencas: Fuel cells directly convert chemical energy into electrical power using electrochemical reactions.
Titulo: Thermodynamic Investigation and Optimization of a Power Generation System Based Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Using Taguchi Approach

Sentencas: Solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) is one of the high-temperature fuel cells that propose a promising future from the standpoint of power generation.
Titulo: Thermodynamic Investigation and Optimization of a Power Generation System Based Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Using Taguchi Approach

Sentencas: In this study, optimization of an SOFC system is performed using Taguchi approach after verification of the model in compare with experimental results.
Titulo: Thermodynamic Investigation and Optimization of a Power Generation System Based Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Using Taguchi Approach

Sentencas: Current density, inlet temperature of SOFC, and utilization factor are considered as input parameters and the electrical power is selected as the output response.
Titulo: Thermodynamic Investigation and Optimization of a Power Generation System Based Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Using Taguchi Approach

Sentencas: The analysis of variance (ANOVA) results indicate that the current density is the most effective parameter on electrical power which has 52% of contribution followed by inlet temperature of SOFC and utilization factor by 25 and 20% of contributions, respectively.
Titulo: Thermodynamic Investigation and Optimization of a Power Generation System Based Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Using Taguchi Approach

Sentencas: The electrical power enhances by increasing current density and inlet temperature of SOFC and reducing utilization factor.
Titulo: Thermodynamic Investigation and Optimization of a Power Generation System Based Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Using Taguchi Approach

Sentencas: Signal to noise ratio (S/N) analysis elucidate that the current density of 9500 A/m(2), the inlet temperature of SOFC of 850 degrees C, and the utilization factor of 75% is the optimum condition in order to achieve the highest electrical power.
Titulo: Thermodynamic Investigation and Optimization of a Power Generation System Based Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Using Taguchi Approach

Sentencas: The results show that the electrical power is 644.3 kW at the optimum condition.
Titulo: Thermodynamic Investigation and Optimization of a Power Generation System Based Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Using Taguchi Approach
